title: Cruise Traffic Surges Across Asia's Ports
blurb: As cruise momentum builds across Asia, the region's ports recorded a bustling year of ship calls and passenger movements in 2025, underscoring a region that is indeed fastest growing when it comes to cruise market growth.

title: Making the Case for Hotels to Enable AI 'Crawlability'
blurb: Leading technology advisors are urging hoteliers to open up to artificial intelligence (AI) search platforms by giving greater access to their crawlers and bots.

title: How Hilton Is Translating 2026 Travel Trends Into Real-World Experiences in Mexico
blurb: Hilton's 2026 Trends Report points to a variety of shifts in how travelers make their vacation choices — namely, their increased likelihood to question the true motivation for each trip.

title: E.U. Mulls Options as Tensions With U.S. Rise Over Greenland
blurb: With another tariff threat announced by Trump, European countries are weighing response options and looking to make free-trade deals beyond the United States.

title: Amid Minnesota Anti-ICE Protests, Two St. Paul Hotels Temporarily Close
blurb: Two downtown St. Paul hotels owned by Mille Lacs Corporate Ventures have temporarily suspended operations, citing "elevated safety and security concerns."

title: Atlas Ocean Voyages Building New Ship: Atlas Adventurer
blurb: Atlas Ocean Voyages' fleet is growing. The cruise line is building a new luxury, eco-friendly expedition sailing yacht with hybrid propulsion and solid sails. The 400-guest vessel will be named Atlas Adventurer.

title: Ted Keith Named SportsTravel Managing Editor
blurb: Ted Keith, a veteran of both Sports Illustrated and Sports Business Journal, has joined SportsTravel as its new managing editor. He will be based at his home in North Carolina.

title: Golden Age for SMEs Provided They Seize the AI Moment
blurb: By the time the SME-focused panel on "Smarter Tourism: Scaling Strategies For Success" was held on the third and final day of TOURISE in Riyadh, one message had been echoing across the corridors – it is time the longtail of travel become the show of travel, and not the sideshow it's long been.

title: Subvention Guide Launched to Give Associations Clarity Around Destination Support
blurb: Conference matchmaking platform Conferli has developed two new tools to help bring structure, comparability and realism to subvention and help associations better understand how they can access destination support.

title: Iconic Marjorie Hotel Opens in Penang
blurb: Penang has welcomed a new MICE-focused hotel with the opening of Iconic Marjorie Penang, a Tribute Portfolio Hotel by Marriott International.

title: Air France and SNCF Extend Train+Air Service to Ouigo
blurb: Air France and rail operator SNCF have added Ouigo services to the 'Train+Air' programme, which combines train and air travel in one ticket.

title: Travel Sector Deals Fell 5% in 2025: GlobalData
blurb: Deal-making across the global travel and tourism sector slowed in 2025, with total deal volume down 5% year over year. According to new data from GlobalData, the decline covers all major deal types.

title: Why Noble Pushes Deeper Into BLTA Arena
blurb: New buy of a 14-property Woodspring portfolio expands Noble's segment growth, surging past 100 units in just over two years.

title: CoStar: '25 U.S. Hotel Occupancy, RevPAR Decline
blurb: Full-year 2025 U.S. hotel occupancy and revenue per available room each declined year over year for the first time since 2020, according to real estate data provider CoStar.

title: Travel Investment, Acquisitions and Public Market Plays in 2025
blurb: The travel startup funding climate remained challenging throughout 2025. Data from a Phocuswright research report, published in early December, warned of a new funding low for the year.

title: U.S.-Mideast Tensions Put Business Travel on Notice
blurb: The Trump administration on Thursday seemed to back off rhetoric from earlier in the week that positioned the United States to begin military action against Iran, but some countries in recent days have increased travel warning levels and some carriers have canceled or limited service to the Middle East.

title: Trending Destinations Travel Advisors Are Booking in 2026
blurb: Travel advisors are often the ones with the first sense of inside knowledge about traveler behaviors and the new travel trends that end up dominating social media feeds and bookings.

title: The Power Is Yours! Voting Now Open for M&IT Awards 2026
blurb: Voting is now open for the M&IT Awards 2026 - and the power to decide the winners is firmly in your hands. Whether you want to champion a standout supplier or start mobilizing support to take home a trophy of your own, now is the moment to get involved.

title: Windstar Expands Fleet With First Newbuild Since the '80s
blurb: Windstar Cruises on Jan. 15 christened its first newbuild in nearly 40 years, marking a critical expansion of the small-ship line. The Star Seeker, equipped to carry 224 passengers, is now grouped with Windstar's Star-class ships that don't feature sail propulsion (Star Breeze, Star Pride and Star Legend).

title: Advisors Weigh In on Interest Rate Direction
blurb: Most members of Hotel Investment Today's advisory board see a 50- to 100-bps cut, but lament the unexpected. Perhaps the most impactful industry discussion surrounds the future of the Federal Reserve's policy on interest rates.

title: IATA Lambasts 'Reckless' Reforms to EU Air Passenger Rights
blurb: Airlines association IATA has warned that planned changes to European air passenger rights could lead to higher travel costs and reduced competition, after the European Parliament this week voted to update regulation.

title: The Experience Surge: Where Meaning, AI and Human Connection Collide
blurb: In an age where travelers crave meaning as much as adventure, the experience economy is surging again, not through algorithms alone, but through the people and purpose behind them.

title: Travelers Without a Real ID Will Soon Be Charged $45
blurb: Beginning Feb. 1, air travelers will be required to show an acceptable form of ID, or to pay to use an alternative identity verification system.

title: Sports Tourism Set to Soar Worldwide in 2026
blurb: Do you get inspired when watching those videos about Olympic athletes overcoming personal and sporting obstacles? If so, you're not alone.

title: What's Giving Malaysia Tourism a Lift?
blurb: It was a good year for Malaysia tourism in 2025, a momentum that is expected to carry into Visit Malaysia (VM2026). Visitor arrivals went up, air connectivity improved, and the country benefitted from a mix of practical policy decisions and shifting regional travel patterns.

title: Danang's Strategy for 12% Growth in MICE Visitors
blurb: Relaxed eligibility criteria, plus additional incentives for returning groups as Danang rolls out its 2026 MICE program. With the launch of a new MICE promotion strategy for 2026, the city is targeting 93,000 MICE visitors, up 12% compared to 2025.

title: Visit Williamsburg Partners with AJGA as Title Sponsor of Junior Championship
blurb: Visit Williamsburg and the American Junior Golf Association have announced a multi-year partnership that establishes Visit Williamsburg as the Title Sponsor of the Visit Williamsburg Junior Championship, an elite junior golf tournament coming to the region later this year.

title: Caroline Beteta Will Retire as President and CEO of Visit California
blurb: After nearly three decades at the helm of Visit California, Caroline Beteta has announced that she will retire from the post of president and CEO this coming September.

title: United: Corp. Demand Outlook 'Amazing' After January Bump
blurb: United Airlines' business demand outlook "is really pretty amazing right now," chief commercial officer Andrew Nocella said during a Wednesday morning earnings call, noting early January business travel revenue increased "high single digits" year over year.

title: Gloria Guevara returns as World Travel & Tourism Council CEO
blurb: The World Travel & Tourism Council's operating committee has appointed Gloria Guevara president and CEO. This is Guevara's second stint as WTTC's president and CEO, previously occupying the role from 2017 to 2021.

title: These River Cruise Ships Will Debut in 2026
blurb: New river ships are getting ready to debut across the world's waterways in 2026, from Egypt's Nile River to Southeast Asia's Mekong and rivers all around Europe.

title: Registration for LA28 Ticket Draw Opens
blurb: Sports fans worldwide are being invited to register for the LA28 Ticket Draw, which opened on January 14. On the eve of the milestone moment, LA28 hosted more than 300 Olympians and Paralympians — representing 28 different Games dating back to 1960 — at the LA Memorial Coliseum.

title: Record 2025 Performance in Canada
blurb: Canda's hotel industry for full-year 2025 reported its highest annual top-line performance on record, according to CoStar data. Occupancy was 66.1% (+0.7% YOY); ADR was CAD216.10 (+3.5% YOY); RevPAR was CAD142.89 (+4.2% YOY).

title: Flair Says Its ULCC Era Is Over: CEO Maciej Wilk Explains Why
blurb: Canada's commercial airline landscape has repeatedly proven unforgiving to ultra-low-cost carriers (ULCCs). But instead of fading into the background, Flair Airlines has quietly redefined its business model.

title: Mews Raises $300M to Expand AI, Fintech Capabilities
blurb: Hospitality management software provider Mews has raised $300 million in a Series D round, bringing the company's valuation to $2.5 billion. Mews said the capital will be use to further invest in artificial intelligence (AI) and fintech.

title: Marketing Powerhouse Emerges as Impact XM and Jack Morton Merge
blurb: Impact XM and Jack Morton have announced a merger that will create one of the world's largest and most comprehensive experiential marketing agencies, operating under the Jack Morton name.

title: Destinations, Accommodations and Tour Companies That Shine for Travelers With Disabilities
blurb: Worldwide, an estimated 1.3 billion individuals—or 1 in 6 people—live with a significant disability. That's about 16 percent of the global population, according to the World Health Organization. And it's a very substantial market of potential travel customers.

title: Caesars Palace Unveils New Villas
blurb: Caesars Palace Las Veas, which is celebrating its 60th anniversary this year, is debuting two new Presidential Villas in its Colosseum Tower and 29 Sky Villas in the Octavius Tower. The property now features 3,980 guest rooms.

title: Eurostar Sees 'Record' Passenger Numbers in 2025
blurb: Eurostar has reported 'record' passenger numbers for 2025, with a 2.6 percent year-on-year increase to 20 million travelers. The record annual figure was driven by "sustained" demand from both leisure and business travelers, the company said.

title: Singaporean Event Tech Company Goes AI-Native
blurb: Event technology company Jublia has rebranded as Jublia AI, reflecting a shift to an AI-native business spanning interface, data capabilities and agentic AI workflows.

title: New Ski Resort Hits the Slopes in Niseko
blurb: The Green Leaf Niseko Village, Tapestry Collection by Hilton resort has opened at the foot of Mount Niseko Annupuri within Niseko Village Ski Resort.

title: FIFA Reports More Than 500 Million Ticket Requests for 2026 World Cup
blurb: FIFA has reported that more than half a billion ticket requests for the 2026 FIFA World Cup were submitted during the Random Selection Draw ticket sales phase, which ran from December 11, 2025 to January 13, 2026.

title: Destinations Emerging Onto the Spotlight in 2026
blurb: As the New Year rolls into view, let's take a look at some destinations that seem ready to emerge onto the global tourism scene as everyone's next bucket-list picks, the way Iceland did only in the past twenty years or so.

title: With Longer Europe Seasons, River Lines Inch Close to Year-Round Operations
blurb: The weather may be chilly in the winter, but river cruising is heating up.

title: Why Google's UCP Is Not a Game Changer in Travel
blurb: If you follow tech headlines, you've likely seen the buzz: Google's Universal Commerce Protocol (UCP) is being hailed as the "e-commerce website-killer" that will turn every AI interaction into a seamless transaction.

title: Travel Tech Firms Enhance NDC Content Through Sabre
blurb: Sabre has announced that five travel technology providers – TPConnects, Vibe, Lleego, Mesh and Ypsilon.net – have signed up to connect to its Mosaic platform to increase their NDC-based airline content.

title: Soho House Go-Private Deal Saved
blurb: Soho House has secured $200 million in alternative funding commitments for its pending take-private deal. The new package includes equity from Morse Ventures ($50 million) and MCR ($50 million).

title: Marketing Platform Constant Contact Acquires GURU Conference
blurb: The digital-marketing platform Constant Contact has acquired select assets from GURU Media Hub, including the popular online GURU Conference, SubjectLine.com, and the Certified GURU email-marketing education and certification program.

title: Hyatt Gets Off the Racetrack With F1
blurb: As the official hospitality partner of the new Audi Revolut F1 Team, World of Hyatt is granting its members access to "iconic" F1 experiences.

title: Capital in Action: The Next Flow – Slower, Smarter, Selective
blurb: In an age of abundant ideas but cautious money, capital is being redefined – slower, smarter, more selective. That was the message from a powerhouse panel of investors and dealmakers at WiT Singapore's session "Capital in Action: Flow for the Next Age."

title: Banff Cracks Top 10 for American Luxury Travelers
blurb: A major skijoring (skiing while pulled by a horse or sometimes sled dog) event last weekend has put Banff in the spotlight, but the mountain town is making waves as a luxury destination according to search data on Google.

title: Why 'Frolleagues' Bond Better Than Team Building Ever Did
blurb: If colleagues are choosing to spend their holidays together as "frolleagues" – friend and colleagues mashed together – why do corporate cohesion programs still struggle to create genuine connection?

title: NCL's John Chernesky Talks Non-Commissionable Fees, Great Stirrup Cay Enhancements and More
blurb: Fresh off the launch of a new marketing campaign and news that it is eliminating non-commissionable fees (NCFs), Norwegian Cruise Line (NCL) has been the talk of town lately.

title: Thrust Carbon Launches Tool to Guide Frequent Travelers' Decisions
blurb: Thrust Carbon has launched a new "behavioral-change tool" designed to reach travelers as they are making travel decisions and guide them toward more sustainable and economic travel options, the company announced.

title: Why the Unwritten Brief Will Win in 2026
blurb: With client teams leaner than ever and budgets tighter, agencies that embrace curiosity and proactive problem-solving will have the edge.
